thread.title: Firm that counts Oscars votes explains shocking Best Picture mix-up and issues apology to all involved
thread.title_full: Firm that counts Oscars votes explains shocking Best Picture mix-up and issues apology to all involved - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Firm that counts Oscars votes explains shocking Best Picture mix-up and issues apology to all involved

organizations.name: 89th annual academy awards red carpet view

text:
Firm that counts Oscars votes explains shocking Best Picture mix-up and issues apology to all involved La La Land mistakenly named winner of Best Picture over Moonlight Share Comments By Zoe Shenton Lara Martin 09:12, 27 FEB 2017 Updated 09:17, 27 FEB 2017 Celebs Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Jennifer Aniston chokes up as she introduces in m Watch this video again Watch Next Jimmy Kimmel live tweets Donald Trump from the Os 1:04 Jimmy Kimmel shows off an Oscars edition of Mean 2:06 Warren Beatty appears confused as Faye Dunaway re 0:29 Emma Stone wins Best Actress 2:12 Referee Romain Poite explaining the rules to Engl 0:47 Airport passenger in a rush take embarrassing tum 0:23 Sony launches new Xperia XZ with super slow motion 1:14 Leeroy Bailey in BGT 2007 final with his dance tr 0:33 Young man convulses on floor as pastor performs ' 0:38 Caught on bodycam: moment cop's wife is found sho 1:05 Video will play in La La Land read out instead of Moonlight in Oscar mix up Share this video Watch Next Share Comments The accountancy firm responsible for counting Oscars votes has apologised for the shocking blunder that saw La La Land mistakenly named Best Picture over the real winner, Moonlight.
A statement from PricewaterhouseCoopers confirmed there had been an error with the wrong envelope handed to Best Picture presenters Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway, which led them to mistakenly crown La La Land the winner.
PWC did not confirm which card Beatty and Dunaway had been handed in error, but reports claim it was the one announcing Emma Stone's earlier win as Best Actress for La La Land, rather than the correct Best Picture winner card.
Warren Beatty holding up the correct Best Picture winner (Photo: AFP) The card for Emma Stone's Best Actress win is believed to have been erroneously given to the Best Picture presenters (Photo: REUTERS) In jaw-dropping scenes, the cast and crew of La La Land were half way through an acceptance speech on stage when the mistake was realised, and they had to hand over their Oscars to Moonlight in front of a TV audience of millions.
In a statement, PWC said: "We sincerely apologize to Moonlight, La La Land, Warren Beatty, Faye Dunaway, and Oscar viewers for the error that was made during the award announcement for best picture,"
"The presenters had mistakenly been given the wrong category envelope and when discovered, was immediately corrected. We are currently investigating how this could have happened, and deeply regret that this occurred."
PWC concluded by thanking the nominees, the Academy, ABC, the network that aired the show, and the Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel for how they reacted.
"We appreciate the grace with which the nominees, the Academy, ABC, and Jimmy Kimmel handled the situation."
Moonlight’s director Barry Jenkins praised the cast and crew of La La Land for being “so gracious” about the shocking Oscars mishap.
PWC thanked Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel for how he handled the situation (Photo: AFP) La La Land producer Jordan Horowitz (L) hands over the Best Picture award to Moonlight's Barry Jenkins (Photo: Getty) Jenkins tweeted this photo as proof his movie won Best Picture (Photo: Twitter/Barry Jenkins) Read More Warren Beatty REFUSES to hand over THAT Oscar envelope to producers backstage - as conspiracy theories flood Hollywood Speaking backstage, Moonlight filmmaker Jenkins said: “Things just happen. The folks from La La Land were so gracious. I can’t imagine being in their position.
“We spent a lot of time together over the last six months, and I can’t imagine being in their position. It’s why I was speechless — I wasn’t speechless because I won, I was so speechless that they had to do that.”
“I’d never seen that happen before,” he added. “It made a special feeling more special but not in the way I expected. The last 20 minutes of my life have been insane … beyond life changing.”
Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in Emma Stone: 'I f***ing love Moonlight' after Oscars mix up Share this video Watch Next La La Land's producer hugs Jenkins on stage (Photo: Getty) Read More How DID Oscars mix-up happen? Twitter explodes with conspiracy theories - including blaming Leo DiCaprio The jaw-dropping live TV error came when Best Picture presenters Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway read the incorrect winner's card, saying Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling's musical had won.
Jenkins said in the Oscar press room he believed there had been two winners cards, which may have caused the confusion.
It's believed Beatty and Dunaway had been given the card announcing Emma Stone's earlier win as Best Actress for La La Land.
“I will say, I saw two cards, and so things just happen. I wanted to see the card, to see the card, and Warren refused to show the card to anybody before he showed it to me," said Jenkins.
"He came upstairs and he walked over to me, and he showed the card. Everyone was asking to see the card and he was like, ‘No, Barry Jenkins has to see the card, I need him to know.’
"And I felt better about what had happened,”
Read More The Oscars 2017 Chaos at Oscars after EPIC blunder Jimmy Kimmel's full Oscars monologue Worst Oscars 2017 fashion fails Full list of Oscars 2017 winners Oscars pay tribute to Bill Paxton Best dressed at Oscars 2017 How did Oscars 2017 fail happen? Actress hit in face during Oscars La La Land producer Jordan Horowitz holds up the winner card reading actual Best Picture winner Moonlight (Photo: Getty) Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in Emma Stone reveals she had the envelope the whole time Share this video Watch Next The stunning scenes unfolded during the biggest awards ceremony of the year, which was broadcast live from Los Angeles to millions of people around the world.
After starting an acceptance speech, the La La Land cast and crew conceded there had been an error.
"I'm sorry, no, there's a mistake. This is not a joke, Moonlight has won Best Picture. This is not a joke. Moonlight has won Best Picture," La La Land producer Jordan Horowitz pointed out.
Warren later explained the mix up (Photo: AFP) Host Jimmy Kimmel looked completely perplexed as Warren explained that he had misread the card.
"This is very unfortunate what happened. I would like to see you get an Oscar anyway, why can't we just give out a whole bunch?" the late night TV star said.
Addressing the crowd, Warren added: “I want to tell you what happened. I opened the envelope and it said Emma Stone La La Land.
"That’s why I took such a long look at Faye and you [Kimmel]. I wasn’t trying to be funny. This is Moonlight - the Best Picture."
Moonlight actor Mahershala Ali gave Emma a huge following the flub - but Ryan's face says it all (Photo: Getty Images North America) "I wasn't trying to be funny," Warren told the audience (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Viola Davis reduces Oscars audience to tears with emotional acceptance speech for best supporting actress award The cast and crew of Moonlight then took to the stage and Horowitz gave them the Oscar and embraced the rightful winners.
“I’m still not sure this is real,” Moonlight producer Adele Romanski said, also speaking for every shocked viewer at home and in the audience of the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood.
The cast of Moonlight eventually went to collect the gong (Photo: REUTERS) "I'm still not sure this is real," Moonlight producer Adele Romanski said (Photo: AFP) Read More 'How did that actually happen?': Reaction and conspiracy theories as an unprecedented disaster strikes at the Oscars The Damien Chazelle musical still won big on the night, picking up prizes for cinematography and production design, Best Original Song for City of Stars and Best Original Score, while Emma took home the Best Actress gong.
Elsewhere during the ceremony, Manchester by the Sea star Casey Affleck won Best Actor, and Best Supporting Actor and Actress went to Moonlight's Mahershala Ali and Fences actress Viola Davis respectively.
